title: UCLA students and faculty standing in silence protest over the Vietnam War, 1966
creator: Photographer: Malmin, John Publisher: Los Angeles Times
description: SILENT HOUR ON CAMPUS-UCLA students and faculty members stand silently in a line to demonstrate their concern over Vietnam. Not a word was spoken for 60 minutes.
subject: UCLA; Protest; Activism; Crowds; Students; Black-and-white photographs; Campus  Activism;
source: UCLA Library Digitial Collections Los Angeles Times Photographic Collection

title: UCLA student from Bruin Young Republicans being turned away from campus teach-in on Vietnam, 1965
creator: Publisher:Los Angeles Times
description: SIGN BEARER-Pat Dunnebeck, UCLA senior from Pomona and secretary of Bruin Young Republicans, tried to enter a campus teach-in on Vietnam with a sign prepared by advocates of U.S. policy in Asia but she was turned away.

title: Mayor Samuel W. Yorty surrounded by UCLA students who oppose Yorty's support of the Vietnam War, Los Angeles, Calif., 1966
creator: Photographer: Cox, Bruce H. Publisher: Los Angeles Times
description: STUDENT CRITICS-Mayor Samuel W. Yorty runs into heckling from students who oppose U.S. policies in Vietnam as he takes part in UCLA campus program designed to demonstrate support for the war effort.

title: Politician Eugene J. McCarthy leading San Fernando Valley State College students on anti-war march in Northridge, Calif., 1972
creator: Photographer: Markado, Al Publisher: Los Angeles Times
description: MCCARTHY LEADS MARCH-- Former Sen. Eugene J. McCarthy of Minnesota leads more than 500 Valley State College students in a march to Teledyne Inc. of Northridge. The firm, protesting students said, supplies products used by the military in Vietnam. McCarthy, who gave an antiwar speech on the campus Wednesday, led the march for about five blocks and then was whisked away in an automobile.
subject: UCLA; Protest; Activism; Students; Civil disobedience; Campus Activism; Activism; Black-and-white Photograph; Protest Signs; Crowds;
source: UCLA Library Digital Collections - Los Angeles Times Photographic Collection
access_restrictions: UCLA Library Special Collections, A1713 Charles E. Young Research Library, Box 951575, Los Angeles, CA 90095-1575. Email: spec-coll@library.ucla.edu. Phone: (310) 825-4988
citation: Markado, Al. Politician Eugene J. McCarthy leading San Fernando Valley State College students on anti-war march in Northridge, Calif., 1972. 11 May 1972. UCLA Library Digital Collections - Los Angeles Times Photographic Collection, www.digital.library.ucla.edu/catalog/ark:/21198/zz0002nknq. Los Angeles Times.

title: Anti-war protest
creator: Spartan Daily (Creator)
description: Male student holds a sign in front of an ROTC advertisement promoting the Marines. The signs read: 1) Join the Marines. Learn to kill Presidents, Destroy homes and burn children; 2) Be a leader of men, be an officer in the Marines.

title: Anti-war and anti-draft protest
creator: Spartan Daily (Creator)
description: Anti-war and anti-draft student protest. In this view, three students are eating ice cream cones while listening to two other students. Posters announcing a student strike for peace event are situated between the seated student. A large peace symbol is prominent on the poster on the left, and to the right, a mock oversized poster reads: "Selective Service System Certificate," with "Resist April 29, 1968," written across the certificate.
subject: San Jose State University, Students, Pacifism, Political Art
source: San Jose State University, Special Collections and Archives - https://calisphere.org/item/6598d159f2900ea4187dcf1a2f74a49e/
